pageContext.claim: “And as I've said, and I'll say it any number of times -- and this is not using nuclear -- we could win that war in a week if we wanted to fight it. But I'm not looking to kill 10 million people. I'm not looking to kill 10 million Afghans, because that's what would have to happen, and I'm not looking to do that.”
pageContext.analysis: The U.S. has had a presence in Afghanistan for 18 years. Trump’s suggestion would wipe out one-third of the Afghani population and many experts believe would require nuclear force, which would be a shocking and unprecedented world event indistinguishable from genocide. Still, there’s no guarantee that such an extreme move would ultimately lead to a stable Afghanistan.
